summary: This bill, the PFAS National Drinking Water Standard Act of 2025, aims to codify a national primary drinking water regulation for PFAS (Per- and Polyfluoroalkyl Substances). It mandates that the final rule issued by the EPA on April 26, 2024, regarding PFAS in drinking water, be legally enforced. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on June 26, 2025, by Mr. Fitzpatrick (for himself and Mrs. Dingell) and was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce.
